title: National Former Prisoner of War Recognition Day, 2025
summary: The document is a proclamation by President Donald J. Trump designating April 9, 2025, as National Former Prisoner of War Recognition Day. It honors American service members who were captured during wars and acknowledges their sacrifices in defending freedom. The proclamation emphasizes the commitment of the current administration to support veterans, particularly former prisoners of war, and highlights the issue of veteran homelessness, pledging to eradicate it. The President calls for national observance of the day through ceremonies and activities to express gratitude for the sacrifices made by former POWs and their families. The document reflects a dedication to restoring peace and unity while recognizing the upcoming 250th anniversary of the U.S. Army.
